intro: Schrankia, commonly known as the Schrankia genus, consists of several species of flowering plants native to Africa. These plants are typically shrubs or small trees, characterized by their woody stems and simple, alternate leaves. Schrankia species often produce small, clustered flowers that can be white, yellow, or green, depending on the species. They are adapted to arid or semi-arid environments, showing some degree of drought tolerance. The genus is part of the Rubiaceae family, which includes other well-known plants like coffee and gardenias.
